paper_title.ja: 調波平衡法による２自由度のパラメトリック発振現象に関する検討
paper_title.en: Investigation of Two-degree-of-freedom Parametric Oscillation by the Harmonic Balance Method

description.ja: We previously proposed a technique to analyze a planar parametric transformer using the harmonic balance method. The calculated characteristics of the transformer agreed approximately with the experimental ones. We analyze here the characteristics of two-degree-of-freedom parametric oscillation to confirm the validity of analysis of a parametric oscillation using the harmonic balance method. The characteristics of the relation between the input and output voltages and the phase of the two-degree-of-freedom parametric oscillation device were obtained using thismethod.
description.en: We previously proposed a technique to analyze a planar parametric transformer using the harmonic balance method. The calculated characteristics of the transformer agreed approximately with the experimental ones. We analyze here the characteristics of two-degree-of-freedom parametric oscillation to confirm the validity of analysis of a parametric oscillation using the harmonic balance method. The characteristics of the relation between the input and output voltages and the phase of the two-degree-of-freedom parametric oscillation device were obtained using thismethod.

en.name: Masaaki Yoshida, Masaru Ohta, Mitsuo Natsusaka, Yoshinori Sakamoto

publication_name.en: Journal of the Magnetic society of Japan

paper_title.en: Considerations on the operating point of a planar parametric transformer based on the Mathieu equation

description.en: A planar parametric transformer using a laminated Si-Fe core has been proposed by the authors. The stable or unstable states of a parametric oscillation are represented by the Mathieu equation. The Mathieu equations under no-load and load conditions are obtained in this paper. The relationships between the stable-unstable state of a parametric oscillation and the operating point of the transformer are also obtained. Moreover, the stability chart of Mathieu equation is estimated. The obtained results can be useful for the optimum design of a planar parametric transformer. MATLAB is used for the theoretical analysis. © 2010 IEEE.

paper_title.ja: パラメトリックモータの発振方程式に関する考察
paper_title.en: Analysis of Equation of Parametric Oscillation in Parametric Motor

description.ja: A parametric motor using parametric oscillation phenomena, offers numerous attractive features not found in conventional motors, such as overload protection, simple construction, low cost, and less noise. However, there are abnormal phenomena, such as normal-reverse rotations and intermittent rotations in the motor. The basic operating equation for these motors can be represented using a Mathieu differential equation. This paper discusses the relationships between the stability of parametric oscillations and the nonlinear terms that compose the Mathieu equation. As a result, the relationships between them are made clear and the guiding principle of design of the motor is obtained.
description.en: A parametric motor using parametric oscillation phenomena, offers numerous attractive features not found in conventional motors, such as overload protection, simple construction, low cost, and less noise. However, there are abnormal phenomena, such as normal-reverse rotations and intermittent rotations in the motor. The basic operating equation for these motors can be represented using a Mathieu differential equation. This paper discusses the relationships between the stability of parametric oscillations and the nonlinear terms that compose the Mathieu equation. As a result, the relationships between them are made clear and the guiding principle of design of the motor is obtained.

paper_title.en: Relationships between Inner Stator Shape and Performance Characteristics of Laminated Core Parametric Motor

description.ja: We earlier proposed a parametric motor using a laminated Si-Fe core. This paper concerns the relationships between inner stator shape and performance characteristics of the motor. Torque-speed characteristics of the motor, output, and efficiency were significantly improved by giving the stator a hybrid asymmetric shape.
description.en: We earlier proposed a parametric motor using a laminated Si-Fe core. This paper concerns the relationships between inner stator shape and performance characteristics of the motor. Torque-speed characteristics of the motor, output, and efficiency were significantly improved by giving the stator a hybrid asymmetric shape.

paper_title.ja: 120°回転対称形固定子を用いた単相入力-三相パラメトリックモータ
paper_title.en: Single-Phase-Input Three-Phase Parametric Motor, Using 120-degree Rotationally Symmetrical Stator

description.ja: A three-phase induction motor excited by a single-phase power supply is proposed. We fabricated small prototype motor with six poles, having an exciting circuit and two parametric oscillation circuits arranged in the stator. The inner stator of the motor has 120-degrees rotational symmetry. A three-phase rotating field was successfully generated in the stator. The fundamental characteristics of the motor are also discussed.
description.en: A three-phase induction motor excited by a single-phase power supply is proposed. We fabricated small prototype motor with six poles, having an exciting circuit and two parametric oscillation circuits arranged in the stator. The inner stator of the motor has 120-degrees rotational symmetry. A three-phase rotating field was successfully generated in the stator. The fundamental characteristics of the motor are also discussed.

paper_title.ja: 平面磁路形パラメトリックモータの固定子形状と鉄損の関係
paper_title.en: Relationship between Stator Shape and Iron Loss in a Laminated-core Parametric Motor.

description.ja: We earlier proposed a parametric motor using a laminated core. This paper discusses, the relationship between stator shape and iron loss in the motor. Square and round outer shapes were used for an experimental stator. The efficiency of the square-stator motor was less than that of the round-stator motor. We investigated the iron loss of the motor and analyzed the distribution of flux density in the stator using the finite element method, to determine the reason for the difference in efficiency. Results showed that the iron loss of the square-stator motor is larger than that of the round-stator motor.
description.en: We earlier proposed a parametric motor using a laminated core. This paper discusses, the relationship between stator shape and iron loss in the motor. Square and round outer shapes were used for an experimental stator. The efficiency of the square-stator motor was less than that of the round-stator motor. We investigated the iron loss of the motor and analyzed the distribution of flux density in the stator using the finite element method, to determine the reason for the difference in efficiency. Results showed that the iron loss of the square-stator motor is larger than that of the round-stator motor.

paper_title.ja: 平面磁路積層形パラメトリックモータ特性の磁極配置依存性
paper_title.en: Effects of Pole Arrangements on Fundamental Characteristics of a Laminated-core Parametric Motor.

description.ja: We earlier investigated a new type of parametric motor using a laminated iron core, and we showed that the output and efficiency of a prototype motor are comparable to those of conventional single-phase capacitor motors. This paper discusses the performance characteristics and the stability of parametric oscillation of a motor having a stator with an asymmetrically arranged pole. Parametric oscillation was stabilized and the output and efficiency were significantly improved by giving the stator an asymmetric shape.
description.en: We earlier investigated a new type of parametric motor using a laminated iron core, and we showed that the output and efficiency of a prototype motor are comparable to those of conventional single-phase capacitor motors. This paper discusses the performance characteristics and the stability of parametric oscillation of a motor having a stator with an asymmetrically arranged pole. Parametric oscillation was stabilized and the output and efficiency were significantly improved by giving the stator an asymmetric shape.

paper_title.en: Three-phase parametric induction motor excited by a single-phase power supply

description.en: A new type of three-phase induction motor excited by a single-phase power supply has been proposed. A small trial motor with six poles was fashioned with an exciting circuit and two parametric oscillation circuits arranged in the stator. A three-phase rotating field has successfully been generated in the stator. The fundamental characteristics of the motor are also being studied.

presentation_title.ja: 平面磁路形パラメトリック変圧器の磁路形状と動作点の軌跡
presentation_title.en: Relation between Shape of Magnetic Path and Trajectory of Operating Point in a Planar Parametric Transformer

event.ja: 八戸工業高等専門学校紀要

promoter.ja: 八戸工業高等専門学校

description.ja: We previously proposed a planar parametric transformer using a laminated Si-Fe core. In that study, it was noted that there was a relationship between the shape of the magnetic path and the trajectory of the operating point. In this paper, we report on the following: (1) the trajectory of the operating point in the transformer moves parallel to the q'-axis in the a'-q' plane for a shape of the magnetic path, indicating that parametric oscillations are stable. (2) the trajectory of the operating point approaches the area where the parametric oscillations stops, because approximated coefficients changes with the shape of the magnetic path. (3) the trajectory of the operating point is affected by the approximate coefficients of first-order and fifth-order polynomials for the magnetic flux of the magnetic saturation curve. These states of a transformer were analyzed using MATLAB.
description.en: We previously proposed a planar parametric transformer using a laminated Si-Fe core. In that study, it was noted that there was a relationship between the shape of the magnetic path and the trajectory of the operating point. In this paper, we report on the following: (1) the trajectory of the operating point in the transformer moves parallel to the q'-axis in the a'-q' plane for a shape of the magnetic path, indicating that parametric oscillations are stable. (2) the trajectory of the operating point approaches the area where the parametric oscillations stops, because approximated coefficients changes with the shape of the magnetic path. (3) the trajectory of the operating point is affected by the approximate coefficients of first-order and fifth-order polynomials for the magnetic flux of the magnetic saturation curve. These states of a transformer were analyzed using MATLAB.

description.ja: We earlier proposed a planar parametric transformer using a laminated Si-Fe core. In our study, we noticed the Mathieu equation represented the stable state or unstable state of a parametric oscillation. In this paper, (1) the Mathieu equation is obtained for the no-load condition and the load condition, and (2) the relationship between the stable state or unstable state of a parametric oscillation and the operating point of the transformer is clarified. We analyzed these states of a transformer by using MATLAB.
description.en: We earlier proposed a planar parametric transformer using a laminated Si-Fe core. In our study, we noticed the Mathieu equation represented the stable state or unstable state of a parametric oscillation. In this paper, (1) the Mathieu equation is obtained for the no-load condition and the load condition, and (2) the relationship between the stable state or unstable state of a parametric oscillation and the operating point of the transformer is clarified. We analyzed these states of a transformer by using MATLAB.
